channel.title: Georgios Diapoulis personal blog
channel.description: Recent content on Georgios Diapoulis personal blog

item.title: SC3 and scikit-learn
item.description: This blog post is about machine learning techniques in live coding. I particularly focused on SuperCollider (SC3) and scikit-learn library for Python3. The main procedure was to send data over Open Sound Control (OSC) protocol, using pythonosc, and to analyze the data in Python3. The data analysis results are sending back to sclang in real-time for parameter control UGens. Description and order of execution The main idea is to get input of environmental sounds using a microphone (also input from speakers works fine), and to analyze the input based on Chromagram class from SC3.

item.title: About
item.description: About this blog This blog includes notes on programming tools and music-related topics. You will find posts related to music cognition and technology and notes on programming. More specifically about Emacs, Orgmode, Arch Linux, SuperCollider and more. The blog serves mostly as a personal notebook. If you find anything useful in here I will be more than happy. About me I am PhD student. static/diapoulis.jpeg CV You can find a short CV here.

item.title: Moving to Hugo
item.description: This blog entry provide information about the setup of a Hugo blog using orgmode. Hugo has been established in the field of static websites and blogs. It is based on Go programming language. The user is writing her posts in Markdown which makes it easy to use. I decided to quit Jekyll (and particular org2jekyll) and to begin a new blog using Hugo & orgmode. Hugo has a large collection of templates, and the present template is called hugo-dusk.

item.title: Publications
